forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 58. West southwest wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Labor Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 74, with temperatures falling to around 72 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 8 to 17 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn approaches in Downtown San Francisco, the night retains a whisper of solitude, with the air gently cradling the city in a cool embrace, a comfortable low of 58 taking center stage. The west-southwest winds, coursing at eight miles per hour, promise a refreshing touch, stirred but not gusty enough to ruffle any plans. 

As Labor Day unfurls its bright wings, the promise of sun beckons; an inviting high near 74 will gradually settle to a pleasant 72 as the afternoon unfolds. The horizon will gleam under a broadly smiling sky, devoid of the customary fog that often wraps the Golden Gate in its mysterious shroud. Instead, expect clarity in the day, where shadows dance playfully and colors emerge vibrant against the blue expanse. Such conditions offer an opportunity to step outside in light layers—a comfortable shirt and perhaps a light sweater should the breeze sharpen. As the city awakens, there’s a gentle allure to wandering through the tree-lined streets or savoring a warm cup of coffee in an open-air café. Whether you choose to explore the rich tapestry of local artists or simply meander along the waterfront, today holds the promise of serene discovery in the warm embrace of early autumn.
